name: High Dunes Watch
culture_adjustments: apprenticeship tied to rotational watch duty rather than central guild halls
watch-family kin-lines dominate offices and rites
tide-festivals emphasize protection from sand-winds and shipwreck rites
constraints: scarce fresh water limits population and large workshops
shifting dunes prevent major harbor construction
ritual magic dependent on imported reagents with slow resupply
notes: linear watchtower chain links province into state augury network
daily bearing reports dispatched to state convoys and guilds
salt production operates under state guild license and quotas
